data.title: CCIE Certified Cisco Router Expertise: Maintenance, Upgrades, and Troubleshooting
meta_keywords: Cisco RV Series VPN Router Consulting Firm
Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router Remote Support
Cisco Carrier Routing System Router Consultants
data.meta_description: Progent can provide planning and troubleshooting help for Cisco's older routers and for Cisco's modern routers such as Cisco 1000 and 4000 Series ISR routers, Cisco Meraki MX routers, Cisco ASR 9000 aggregation routers, and Catalyst 8500 WAN Edge routers.
data.text:
The current generation of routers ordinarily come with L2 switches, and many of today's switches include some Layer 3 routing functionality. Routers offered by Cisco, the source of 90% of the industry's routers, have improved dramatically in function and speed and Cisco now offers a comprehensive portfolio that features routers engineered to handle the requirements of users ranging from individual telecommuters to the world's largest ISPs.

The latest ISR routers from Cisco offer the performance and integrated functionality to manage data voice and video plus virtual environments while at the same time offering fault tolerance, web-based administration, seamless expandability, and enhanced protection. Cisco's ISR routers allow you to build a solid foundation for an IT environment that can grow seamlessly as you hire new workers, open new sites, deploy additional functions, extend your network to clients and partners, and build an expanding mobile workforce. Progent's Cisco qualified CCIE network consultants can provide fast and economical remote expertise to help you to select, configure, administer, upgrade, and troubleshoot Cisco's most advanced routers and can help you to maintain your older routers or move efficiently to Cisco's current networking products.

Cisco Routers for Home Offices and Small Offices and Branches

Cisco's routers for smaller companies and branch offices offer low-cost and reliable entry-level solutions that allow small groups of workers to share safe connectivity to the Internet. These fixed-configuration desktop devices include at least four switched Ethernet with wireless options and integrated firewall to provide advanced protection. Designed for simple installation, management, and support, Cisco's entry-level routers reduce ownership costs by cutting equipment and operational expenses. Progent's remote support specialists have extensive experience delivering immediate and economical technical help for small companies to set up and maintain these devices, and Progent's CCIE-certified network engineers can assist you to understand ways Cisco's small office routers can add to the strategic value of your IT network.

Cisco ISR 900 Series Integrated Services Routers

Cisco's ISR 900 Series routers are compact, quiet, set-configuration appliances intended for small to medium-sized businesses, branch offices, and home offices. These value-priced routers include four GE LAN ports and offer Metro Ethernet, LTE, and DSL WAN connections. Cisco's ISR 900 router product line provides triple the IPsec performance of Cisco's ISR 800 Series family of routers. All ISR 900 models offer Group Encrypted Transport VPN, dynamic multipoint virtual private network VPN (DMVPN), FlexVPN, and firewall. VPN throughput is as high as 250 Mbps. All models allow up to 50 virtual LANs. Supported automatic failover technology for high availability include VRRP, Hot Standby Router Protocol (HSRP), and MHSRP. Setup and management can be performed with Cisco CP Express, Cisco DNA Center, and Cisco IOS Software. Cisco ISR 900 Series devices do not work with Cisco SD-WAN.

Cisco's ISR 921 router features dual GE WAN ports, Category 4 LTE, and an internal power supply. GE WAN VPN throughput is 150 Mbps. The ISR 926 and ISR 927 models include external power and support a single WAN port, LTE Cat 4, VDSL2 and ADSL2/2+. GE WAN VPN performance for both routers is 150 Mbps. The top-of-the-line ISR 931 router features dual GE WAN ports and includes an internal power supply. GE WAN VPN throughput is 250 Mbps.

Cisco Meraki MX Series SD-WAN Security Appliances

The Cisco Meraki MX series of desktop routers provide software-defined wide area networking and cloud-hosted unified threat management (UTM) in a single small-footprint device able to handle 50 to 200 users. Every MX series appliance must be licensed to the Meraki cloud. For sites having several external network connections (e.g., MPLS, fiber optic, cellular), SD-WAN technology allows admins to assign the WAN interface an app uses or to build performance-based algorithms to determine the appropriate connection. Cisco Meraki MX fixed-configuration desktop security appliances share important features that include:

App and identity-based firewalling

Content and web search filtering

PCI-compliant Intrusion Detection and Prevention

Advanced Malware Protection (AMP) with reputation-based filtering

Load balancing to combine several WAN connections into a single high-speed connection with policy-based QoS, traffic shaping, and fast failover

Works with all IPsec VPN devices and services

USB port for fast 3G/4G failover

Wi-Fi versions have 802.11ac Wave 2 2x2 MU-MIMO

The Cisco Meraki MX64 router provides 250 Mbps firewall throughput, 100 Mbps site-to-site VPN throughput, and supports a maximum of 50 VPN connections. The MX64 includes a GbE RJ45 WAN interface, a dual-purpose GbE RJ45 port, and four GbE RJ45 LAN interfaces. The Cisco Meraki MX67 router delivers 500 Mbps firewall performance, 300 Mbps site-to-site VPN performance, and allows a maximum of 50 VPN tunnels. The router includes a GbE RJ45 WAN port, a dual-purpose GbE RJ45 WAN/LAN interface, and four GbE RJ45 LAN interfaces. The Cisco Meraki MX68 security appliance delivers 600 Mbps stateful firewall performance, 300 Mbps site-to-site VPN throughput, and allows up to 50 VPN connections. The router includes two GbE RJ45 WAN ports and 10 fixed GbE RJ45 LAN interfaces (two include PoE+). The MX75 security appliance provides 1 Gbps stateful firewall throughput, 500 Mbps VPN performance, and supports up to 75 VPN connections. The MX75 comes with one GbE SFP interface, two GbE RJ45 WAN interfaces, and 10 fixed GbE RJ45 LAN interfaces (two with PoE+).

Cisco 1000 and 1100 Family ISR Enterprise Branch Routers

Cisco 1000 Series Integrated Services Routers (ISRs) using Cisco IOS XE internetworking operating system are a selection of fanless appliances intended to provide network connectivity, wireless access, and multilayer security for SMBs, enterprise branches, retail stores, kiosks, and machine-to-machine (M2M) venues. Parallel CPU cores and the ability to run Cisco IOS XE enable these routers to deliver features consistent with Cisco's entire family of modern Enterprise routers. 1000 family ISR models are available with 4 or 8 LAN switch ports and provide Gigabit Ethernet packet forwarding. Various models include Power over Ethernet (PoE) and PoE+, auto provisioning, plus a selection of built-in or pluggable connections including LAN, WAN, wireless LAN, G.fast DSL, LTE wireless, 802.11ac Wi-Fi, and SFP. Cisco 1000 and 1100 Series ISR routers can be used with Cisco's SD-WAN subscription services for seamless multiple-cloud access, advanced cybersecurity, and cohesive administration across hybrid networks.

Cisco's 1RU or desktop ISR 1100-4G router comes with four built-in GE WAN/LAN ports, integrated 3G/4G LTE wireless with two LTE antenna connectors, and one micro-SIM slot. Encryption packet processing speed is 200 Mbps. The Cisco 1100-6G ISR router also includes two 1G SFP connections and delivers encryption throughput of 520 Mbps. Cisco's desktop-only 1101-4P ISR router includes four integrated GE connections, supports 802.11ac Wi-Fi as well as 3G/4G LTE wireless, and delivers encryption performance of 280 Mbps. Cisco's ISR 1109-2P/4p desktop routers have two or four built-in switched GE ports and two pluggable 3G/4G LTE ports. Encryption performance is 200 Mbps.

Cisco's rackmount or desktop ISR 111x-4P/8P routers have four or eight built-in switched GE ports (two or four provide PoE) and feature VDSL2/ADSL2+, 802.11ac Wi-Fi, 3G/4G LTE wireless, and SFP. Encryption speed is 280 Mbps. Cisco's 1RU or desktop ISR 1111X-8P router comes with eight switched GE interfaces (four with Power over Ethernet) and supports SFP. Encryption throughput is 340 Mbps. The ISR 112x-8P router has eight built-in switched GE ports with PoE and features SHDSL, VDSL2/ADSL2+, 802.11ac Wi-Fi, 3G/4G LTE, and 1G SFP. Encryption speed is 340 Mbps. Cisco's 1161X-8P ISR router includes eight built-in switched GE interfaces with PoE and provides 3G/4G LTE wireless and SFP. Encryption packet processing rate is 450 Mbps.

Cisco Catalyst 8000 Series Branch and WAN Edge Platforms for SD-WAN and Routing

Cisco's Catalyst 8000 Series routers are modular appliances designed to work at the enterprise branche and the WAN edge to support hybrid networks that can incorporate multiple public and private clouds and cloud-hosted applications. All Catalyst 8000 devices are powered by Cisco IOS XE SD-WAN Software and provide scalability, intelligent cybersecurity, and 5G access. Throughput is enhanced via custom hardware, a multicore architecture, high port density, and in-line encryption. Cisco's subscription software services provide continual access to the latest SD-WAN technology and enable centralized management with advanced cybersecurity, application-optimized policies, segmentation, and cloud integration.

Cisco Catalyst 8200 Enterprise Edge Routers

Catalyst 8200 routers are upgrades to Cisco's 4300 Series ISRs, offering higher IPsec throughput and scale, hardware-accelerated encryption, plus higher built-in WAN interface density. These one-rack unit routers are designed to provide Cisco's Secure Access Service Edge, Software-Defined WAN and 5G-connection technology to enterprise branches and the enterprise WAN edge. Cisco's Catalyst C8200L-1N-4T model includes four CPU cores, supports 500 Mbps IPsec performance, and permits 1,500 SD-WAN tunnels. Cisco's Catalyst 8200L router does not support container-based applications. Cisco's Catalyst C8200-1N-4T router features eight CPU cores, provides 1Gb IPsec throughput, permits 2,500 SD-WAN tunnels, and allows edge computing with existing container architectures. Both devices include a Network Interface Module (NIM) slot, a PIM slot, two 1 Gigabit Ethernet WAN copper interfaces, and two 1G Ethernet WAN Small-Form-Factor Pluggable interfaces. 4-port and 8-port 1 Gigabit Ethernet switch NIM modules are supported by both 8200 models.

Cisco Catalyst 8300 Series Enterprise Branch Edge Routers

Catalyst 8300 WAN Edge routers are designed to replace Cisco's 4400 family of Integrated Services Routers, providing Cisco's secure SD-WAN solution to mid-sized and large company branch offices seeking high WAN IPSec performance with unified SD-WAN services. Enhanced capabilities include 5G wireless support, built-in security, WAN MACSec, enhanced Layer 2 switching, and DPI with application-aware optimization. Cisco Catalyst 8300 Series WAN Edge routers enable edge computing for an existing container architecture for Cisco UCS-E modules offered on Cisco's 4000 Series ISR appliances. All models in the Cisco Catalyst 8300 Series line support 4,000 SD-WAN tunnels and feature backup power supplies for high uptime.

The Cisco Catalyst 8300-1N1S-6T router model is a 1RU device that features eight CPU cores and delivers 2G SD-WAN performance and IPsec performance as high as 1.9Gbps. The unit comes with a single SM plug-in slot, a NIM slot, and six built-in 1-Gigabit Ethernet WAN interfaces. The Catalyst 8300-2N2S-6T appliance is a two-rack unit appliance that features 8 CPU cores and supports 2G SD-WAN performance and IPsec data rates as high as 1.9Gbps. The unit has two SM plug-in slots, two NIM slots, and six built-in 1G Ethernet WAN ports. The Cisco Catalyst C8300-1N1S-4T2X router model is a 1RU appliance that has eight CPU cores and supports 5G SD-WAN performance and IPsec performance as high as 15Gbps. The appliance features one one SM plug-in slot, a Network Interface Module slot, two built-in 10-Gigabit Ethernet WAN interfaces, and four fixed 1G Ethernet WAN ports. The Cisco Catalyst C8300-2N2S-4T2X appliance is a two-rack unit model that features 12 CPU cores and offers 5G SD-WAN throughput and IPsec data rates up to 18Gbps. The unit includes two SM expansion slots, two NIM slots, two built-in 10-Gigabit Ethernet WAN interfaces, and four fixed 1G Ethernet WAN ports. LAN expansion modules offered by Cisco range from a 4-port 1-Gigabit Ethernet switch Network Interface Module module to a 50-port Catalyst L2 switch Service Module.

Cisco Catalyst 8500 Aggregation Edge Routers

The Cisco Catalyst 8500 Aggregation Edge routers are fixed, one-rack unit aggregation devices for SD-WAN and colocation environments. Built-in features include route processor, embedded services processor, and aggregation hardware for multiple connection choices. IPsec throughput is double compared to Cisco's prior generation ASR1001-X router. Flexible interface options include 1GE, 10GE, 40GE, and 100GE WAN interfaces. 8500 routers come with redundant power supplies for improved resilience. Software subscription packages allow continuing use of Cisco DNA Center Software for SD-WAN and routing and offer centralized management of security, application-aware policies, network segmentation, and cloud connectivity optimization.

The Cisco Catalyst C8500L-8S4X Aggregation Edge router is intended to provide the same basic functionality as Cisco's ASR 1000 appliance. The C8500L-8S4X comes with four 1/10GE WAN ports and can deliver up to 20 Gbps Cisco Express Forwarding aggregate throughput. SD-WAN IPsec throughput can reach 19Gbps. The Catalyst C8500-12X appliance has 12 built-in 1/10GE WAN interfaces and supports as high as 120 Gbps aggregate throughput. SD-WAN IPsec performance can reach 51 Gbps. The C8500-12X4QC model comes with four built-in 1/10GE WAN interfaces and eight 1-Gigabit ports and can support up to 200 Gbps aggregate throughput. SD-WAN IPsec throughput can reach 68 Gbps. The C8500-20X6C high-density router includes 20 integrated SFP+ interfaces and six x QSFP+ interfaces. Cisco's C8500-20X6C delivers as much as 500 Gbps Cisco Express Forwarding aggregate performance.

Cisco ISR G2 Routers

Cisco's ISR G2 routers are designed to offer satellite offices of large businesses with enhanced video and voice applications, virtual networking, protection, and reliable WAN access. Integrated Services G2 routers feature a design that protects prior investments in service modules for first-generation Integrated Services Routers and reduces down-the-line costs by permitting easy installation of additional modules when they are developed. In comparison to older Integrated Services Routers, Cisco's ISR G2 routers offer 2-7 times more throughput, substantially more, and easier maintenance. All Cisco Integrated Services Generation 2 routers offer gigabit switching and include multi-core CPUs and multigigabit fabric for faster throughput. ISR Generation 2 routers also offer intelligent power management for improved energy efficiency.

A key advance with ISR G2 routers is the Cisco IOS Software Universal image which includes all of the Cisco IOS feature sets so that your company can quickly license and deploy new features as required without needing to download and transfer a different IOS image to yourrouter. Progent's group of CCIE network engineers offer proven expertise to help you to plan, implement, and maintain multi-site deployments of Cisco ISR G2 routers that enhance satellite office productivity and cut the price of expansion and maintenance.

Cisco's ISR 800 Line of Routers

The 800 Series of ISR routers has been superseded by the higher performance Cisco ISR 900 series but is still widely deployed. Cisco's extensive portfolio of 800 Series ISR routers is made up of desktop, fanless devices designed and priced for small businesses, branch locations, retail shops, telecommuters, and customers of ISPs. Many devices in Cisco's 800 family of routers have been released with many options over the course of many years. The 881 Series of ISR routers exemplifies the vast selection of options available within Cisco's 800 product family. Various models in Cisco's 881 router portfolio can enable unified media environments by providing IP voice and video, wireless and data in one integrated appliance. Built-in security can include encryption, VPN tunneling, firewall, and URL filtering. For survivability, available features for Cisco 881 ISR routers include duplicate wide area network links or support for wired broadband WAN connections such as DSL as well as multiple cellular 3G and 4G wireless connections all built into a single appliance.

Cisco's 880 Series of ISR routers allow a wide range of deployment scenarios

The basic Cisco 881 has a 4-port fast Ethernet managed switch that delivers 15 Mbps performance, support for 20 users, 2-port integrated Power over Ethernet, and IPv6 compatibility. Cisco's 881W router includes 802.11g/n Wi-Fi. The 881 SRST router features four FXS ports and 1 FXO port for PSTN fallback with Cisco Survivable Remote Site Telephony. With a Cisco CUBE license, Cisco's 881 ISR router allows SIP trunking to replace outdated PRI lines or foreign exchange-office (FXO) voice connectivity to a PSTN carrier. SIP trunks also connect offsite agents in Cisco Call Center deployments.

4000 Series ISR Routers

Cisco's 4000 Line of ISR Routers are compact modular and expandable platforms intended for organizations with multiple branch offices and offsite users requiring direct communication with in-house data centers as well as public clouds via VPN tunnels and the Internet. Cisco's 4000 series provides the bandwidth needed for hybrid WAN environments to accommodate mobile workers, cloud services, and HD multimedia applications by using WAN optimization, deep packet inspection, and traffic-management technology. Models in Cisco's ISR 4000 family are powered by Cisco's IOS XE software, come in a 1RU or 2RU package, can handle as much as 2 Gbps of throughput, and can have up to 3 network interface module slots, 2 service module slots, 4 integrated 10/100/1000 Ethernet ports, and 8 CPU core integrated server modules. Cisco ISR 4000 models support integrated Gigabit Ethernet, T1/E1, T3/E3, PRI and xDSL. To handle unified communications, the 400o ISR provides comprehensive edge support for policy-enhanced session border control, telephony survivability, and Time Division Multiplexing gateways.

The primary difference between the Cisco 4400 ISR and 4300 Series is dual power supply capability in the 4400 ISR Series, providing a higher level of fault tolerance. The 4321 Integrated Services Router has a 1 RU desktop form factor with two network interface modules, delivers as much as 100 Mbps performance, and can handle 240 Digital Voice and Video Channels. Cisco's 4331 ISR Router comes in a 1 RU package with two network interface modules, provides up to 300 Mbps performance, and allows up to 360 Digital Voice/Video Channels. The 4351 ISR Router has a 2 RU form factor and includes three NIMs, delivers as much as 400 Mbps performance, and allows up to 720 Digital Voice and Video Channels. Cisco's dual power supply 4431 ISR Router has a 2 RU package and includes three network interface modules, provides as much as 1 Gbps throughput, and allows up to 720 Digital Voice/Video Channels. The fault-tolerant 4431 model features a 2 RU form factor and includes three NIMs, delivers up to 2 Gbps performance, and can handle 1200 Digital Voice and Video Channels.

Cisco's Midrange WAN Aggregation Routers and Carrier-class Routers

Cisco's WAN edge and carrier routers offer larger businesses with fast, protected headends to aggregate satellite office and off-site data packets and to offer carriers cost-effective WAN edge routing. Cisco's WAN aggregation and service provider router product line includes the Cisco ASR 1000 routers and the 9000 ASR routers.

Progent's national team of CCIE certified network consultants have in-depth experience working with enterprise businesses and service providers to design optimal installations and smooth upgrades of Cisco's midrange and carrier-class routers. Progent's GIAC-certified information assurance consultants can provide unbiased, independent security vulnerability assessments, penetration testing services and advanced Security information and Event Management (SIEM) solutions to help companies that use Cisco's WAN aggregation routers to meet industry standards and statutory regulations for IT information security and reporting. Progent also offers help with Horizon3.ai's NodeZero platform for pentesting. NodeZero depends on AI technology to simplify the threat evaluation cycle of discovering cybersecurity gaps in network perimeters and inside the internal network, recommending remediation, fixing problems, and verifying successful repairs.

Cisco ASR 1000 WAN Edge Routers

Cisco's ASR 1000 Series Aggregation Services line of routers is positioned in the center of Cisco's midrange devices that focus on acting as headends at the wide area network edge. ASR 1000 routers provide a small footprint, multi-function solution for large businesses looking for satellite office aggregation at multigigabit Ethernet speeds. ASR 1000 Aggregation Services routers introduce an innovative architecture that mixes hardware acceleration with programmable versatility to deliver a multitude of concurrent services without sacrificing dependable responsiveness.

ASR 1000 WAN Edge routers feature Cisco's proprietary QuantumFlow Processor composed of 40 custom Packet Processing Engines (PPEs) that in combination can support as many as 160 concurrent processor threads. This multi-processing structure, in conjunction with hardware acceleration for every service, enables the top-of-the-line ASR 1006 router to expand up to 000 queues, 32K subscribers, 4,000 IPsec VPN tunnels at 10,000 sessions/second, and 2M Netflow records. This processing power permits ASR 1000 Series routers to support a broad range of sophisticated services concurrently in massive volume without suffering performance decay that could violate compliance with SLAs. Examples of these advanced services include Cisco Firewall, intrusion-detection services, NAT, FPM, and deep packet inspection. The ASR 1000 also permits tiered traffic management for applying multiple levels of Quality of Service to a packet in one operation, enhancing the user experience for resource-intensive IP voice and video applications.

Cisco ASR 9000 Series Routers

Cisco's ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers are designed as WAN-edge routers for carriers who need to deliver the highest quality HD multimedia services to home, commercial, and mobile customers by providing always-on operation, high performance, and application awareness. All models in the ASR 9000 family of Aggregation Services Routers are powered by Cisco's IOS XR, a distributed operating system built for continuous availability. Throughput of the Cisco ASR 9000 portfolio of Routers can scale to as high as 96 Tbps per system. the ASR 9000 line of Routers support Gigabit Ethernet (GE), 10 Gigabit Ethernet, and 100 GE and have redundant fabric and power supply, power entry modules, plus backup control planes.

The Cisco ASR 9001 model is a provider-edge router that comes in a 6 RU form factor with 120 Gbps of nonblocking, full-duplex fabric capacity. The Cisco ASR 9001 has two modular bays to accept port adapters for 1 Gigabit, 10 Gigabit, and 40 Gigabit Ethernet. The base chassis incorporates four 10 GE SFP+ ports as well as ports for GPS Stratum 1 clocking, building integrated timing supply (BITS), and management. The Cisco ASR 9904 Router comes in a 6 RU form factor and provides dense 10 and 100 GE connectivity in space-limited environments. The 4-slot router can scale up to 4 Tbps of switching capacity in one box. The ASR 9912 platform comes in a 30 RU form factor and includes 12 slots slots that can provide 550 Gbps of switching capacity. The ASR 9912 Router includes 2 route CPUs as well as 6+1 Fabric Cards for N+1 redundancy.

How Progent's Consultants Can Assist Your Business with Cisco Router Products

Progent's Cisco certified consultants can help you to plan, configure, and maintain a converged network infrastructure that can simplify processes, lower expenses, and accelerate the path to positive return on investment. By teaming Cisco integrated services routers with Catalyst switches expertise and Catalyst and Meraki Wi-Fi wireless expertise, Progent can significantly enhance the business value of your integrated network. Progent offers on-premises and off-site help and can provide data center support throughout the U.S.

To learn more details about Progent's consulting help for Cisco solutions, pick a subject:
